newsitem.title: USA: FileNet to consolidate, sees big charge.
newsitem.headline: FileNet to consolidate, sees big charge.

text.p: FileNet Corp said Wednesday it plans to consolidate its operations and as a result expects to record about $6 million in restructuring and other charges in the second quarter.
The software vendor said it will consolidate its Burlington, Massachusetts, engineering and marketing functions with its Costa Mesa, California, headquarters and cut personnel.
The Costa Mesa, California-based company said the restructuring charge will consist primarily of severance costs, write-off of impaired assets and facility closing costs.
It did not provide an exact figure on the job cuts, but its recent worldwide expansion of its direct sales force remains intact.
